1.brief: properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes
David, the youngest son of Jesse
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

2.brief: properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

properly, (abstractly) a raising (as of the hands in prayer), or rising (of flame); figuratively, an utterance; concretely, a beacon (as raised); a present (as taken), mess, or tribute; figuratively, a reproach (as a burden)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
a donation; euphemistically, tribute; specifically a sacrificial offering (usually bloodless and voluntary)

3.brief: to place (in a very wide application)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

4.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to effect thoroughly; specifically, to glean (also figuratively); by implication (in a bad sense) to overdo, i.e. maltreat, be saucy to, pain, impose (also literal)
an exploit (of God), or a performance (of man, often in a bad sense); by implication, an opportunity
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction)

5.brief: to strike down; by implication, to hammer, stamp, conquer, disband
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to refuse, forbid, dissuade, or neutralize
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

6.brief: to fling down; incipiently to jostle; figuratively, to let alone, desist, remit
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

7.brief: a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to slice, i.e. break open or pierce
to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to scatter, whether in enmity or bounty
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates

8.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
near, with or among; often in general, to
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to be (causatively, make) bare; hence, to empty, pour out, demolish
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

9.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina)
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

10.brief: to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
